horrivel

[h1]Death is not an escape[/h1]
"Slaying Chicken at Dawn" [u]can be said to have developed the online survival horror game to the extreme, and the dark tone can also give players a superior immersive game experience.[/u]
In the game of Death by Daylight, the player will act as a killer or a survivor;
The perspective of the player playing the butcher is a first-person perspective, with powerful abilities, and can also use special abilities to track fugitives.
The four players acting as survivors start the game from a third-person perspective. The advantage of the perspective allows humans to better observe the surrounding environment, so that they can still complete various fancy and difficult actions in the face of the pressure of the butcher.
Of course, sometimes human players must make cruel and correct QAQ decisions under strong pressure.
[h1]Psychological Game of Asymmetric Confrontation[/h1]
The game feature of asymmetric confrontation fills the immersive game experience of Dawn Killing Chicken in one fell swoop. In the face of immersive horror experience and unknown fear, the weakness of human nature is fully reflected. After a wonderful and exciting game, there are still lingering fears.
Is it curled up in the corner, or is it active and calm to face?
[spoiler]Maybe the next person (Tu) emperor, this emperor is you.[/spoiler]
[h1]cheat? Sneak attack?[/h1]
I really didn't expect that the seemingly simple setting can have so many features!
The game is in the game, the game is in series, the game is in the game, the game is in the game, and the climax is overwhelming. The possibility of a turnaround lasts until the last second. He thought of everything the opponent wanted, and he thought more thoroughly than anyone else.
It's not just calm down and think together, you will only see people confused, but once you realize it, you will only feel wonderful and amazing!
Who can imagine that the "chicken-killing game" that even children can play can conjure so many tricks like a kaleidoscope. Among them, the use of psychological tactics is paramount.
[h1]Background setting[/h1]
The evil spirits used human hope as food to create illusions, based on the place where the killer had suffered terrible tragedies before his death, and let the killer hunt down the survivors here.
The game map contains a variety of random interaction points such as trees, grass, houses, etc. The overall weather system will also randomly generate dark or rainy and foggy weather.
In these maps, the higher the score of each game in a single game settlement, the more experience points and blood points will be rewarded in the end.
[spoiler]The subtitle of the game is "Death is not an escape", which means that neither death nor escape is an escape.[/spoiler]
Because the survivor role played by the player is trapped in a world created by the evil spirits, whether it is successful to escape from a certain map, jump into the cellar, or be killed, the survivor will always return to the same place. At the campfire in the beginning of the game, everything that happened just now seemed like a dream. Then be chased and killed again or escaped again, infinite loop.
game character
Survivor (human) has a total of 14 characters, each of which has different skills. Except for the basic characters, you need to pay to purchase DLC to unlock them. Non-copyright characters can also be purchased with the in-game currency "fluorescent splinters".
When entering the game, players can choose their own roles until the end of the round before they can change roles.
When the survivor team repairs 5 generators, the gate will appear to escape. When repairing the generators, humans are likely to be caught and hooked by the butcher. The survivors must consider whether to save their teammates. The survivors can unite and overcome the difficulties. , You can also fight separately.
There is also a special way to win, that is, when there is only 1 survivor on the field, no matter how many generators are left, the cellar on the map will be opened, and the survivor can escape through the cellar without repairing the generator.
The butcher (killer) has a total of 13 characters, each of which has different skills. Except for the basic characters, you need to pay to unlock the lock. When entering the game, the player can choose by himself until the end of the game. The butcher hooks all survivors to sacrifice or kill, and the butcher can win.
[h1]Finally, I wish the killing of chickens get better and better![/h1]

very fun and good craic

The game itself is very fun and addictive. For some reason though, the player base is %60 mentally ill, people. There is going to be times where the killer is going to get you down, and just wait for you to die in that way. And they do it so professionally, It's crazy how many times they did that shit. There are going to be times where the killer is going to camp. There are going to be times where your team doesn't save you from hooks and shit. There are so many bad things in the player base but still, the game is so fucking fun and I love it.

UPDATE:
Oh boy. How innocent was I while typing this review. I thought the survivors were pure human beings. Trying to survive the death, trying to live. But I was wrong. The real devils are the survivors in this game. You have no idea how evil these pure-looking creatures are. In the story, they are the ones being haunted. You would think that this is true until you play killer for a while. You are not hunting them, they are hunting you. These disgusting devils will taunt the shit out of you at every second they possibly can. They will wait minutes in the exit gate just to press CTRL and taunt you. They will use lag hacks just to annoy the shit out of you. In my 20 hours killer experience. I have understood that the killers are more innocent than the survivors.

I would like to iterate, this is NOT a horror game. Yes, the first 20-30 hours will feel very scary and you'll just want to hide and you'll feel helpless. Yes, the first 20-30 hours will make you feel like a menacing and deadly killer who's just toying with the survivors until you eventually murder them all. However, you'll quickly realize that this game is NOT that. This is a competitive 1v4 game with a horror THEME. It can be stressful, laid back and anything in between, but NOT scary.

With that our of the way, this is truly a unique and addictive game. The only kind of it's genre of Cat and Mouse that's truly pulled it off. As Survivor, you feel as if every single person's actions matter to the team as you work together to make it out alive. As killer, you need to micromanage the objectives, survivors and your time, all in an effort to sacrifice the survivors. 

The meat of the game is the looping. Survivor runs away, Killer chases them. Simple on paper, extremely complex and engaging in practice. There's no better feeling in this game than completely outsmarting the killer in a chase and losing them completely, or mind gaming a survivor so they run directly into your arms as a Killer. Even with 435 hours of DBD, I still feel like I have a LOT more to learn and improve upon, both with basic mechanics and specific tech. 

I COULD go on about this game for hours, however, I would recommend getting the game and trying it yourself, as it really is it's own unique experience that really is worth getting into.
